meanings.definition: The quality of a color as determined by its dominant wavelength and intensity.
meanings.sent1: The chrominance of the painting was so vibrant that it caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent2: The artist carefully adjusted the chrominance of the image to make the colors pop.
meanings.sent3: The party decorations had such bright chrominance that they seemed to dance in the light.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter had a chrominance that painted the room with joy.
meanings.sent5: The chrominance of the sunset painted the sky in shades of orange and pink.

meanings.definition: The attribute of a color that differentiates it from achromatic colors.
meanings.sent1: The chrominance of the flower made it stand out among the green leaves.
meanings.sent2: The chrominance of the flag made it easy to spot in the crowd.
meanings.sent3: The chrominance of the candy wrapper made it look like a tiny rainbow.
meanings.sent4: His voice had a chrominance that set it apart from the others in the choir.
meanings.sent5: The chrominance of her dress made her the center of attention at the party.
